Unpacking the latest trends and strategies from industry-leading SEO experts ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Amine Faitas
Group Head of SEO at eDreams ODIGEO
"Content is still king in the SEO world, and relevance is its queen."
Our SEO Spotlight series brings you insightful tips and perspectives from industry-leading marketers. Today, Amine Faitas, Group Head of SEO at eDreams ODIGEO, shares his thoughts on how new technologies are reshaping SEO and ways to remain agile in a fast-paced, competitive industry.
Amine Faitas leads digital marketing initiatives for the world's largest online travel company in the flight sector and Europe's most profitable publicly traded ecommerce company, eDreams ODIGEO. He specializes in managing colossal digital ecosystems-specifically, websites with over 10 million indexable pages-by orchestrating targeted, data-driven campaigns.
What emerging SEO trend have you noticed?
In the fast-paced world of digital marketing, being adaptable and tech-savvy isn't just helpful-it's essential.
As we move through 2023, it's becoming increasingly clear that technology is reshaping digital marketing: think SEO automation and artificial intelligence (AI).
Together, they can efficiently handle time-consuming tasks like keyword research and technical analysis, allowing teams to focus more on planning and strategy.
But the real game-changer is predictive analytics. This technology helps businesses prepare for what's coming next and make more informed decisions about where to allocate resources, which is vital for growth.
What is your number-one struggle with SEO right now? How are you solving it?
One of our biggest SEO challenges is accurately interpreting data in the ever-changing search results page in the travel industry, one of the most competitive industries out there.
Google's evolving search results page, filled with more paid and travel-related features like Google Flights, can skew traditional SEO ranking data.
For example, showing up first in a Google Flights search on the SERP isn't the same as being first in organic search, so it doesn't provide a true picture of how you stack up against competitors.
To tackle this, we've built our own ranking system based on Pixel Position and fed the data into our real-time analytics dashboard, where we monitor our markets, keywords, and competitors.
Pixel Position is a more stable metric that helps us better understand actual changes in the page layout-empowering our marketers to make quick and informed decisions based on real-world usage.
What is your SEO tool of choice?
When it comes to SEO tools, I frequently rely on Semrush for in-depth SERP analysis that goes beyond surface-level rankings and understands contextual relevance and user intent.
Listing Management
This makes our SEO adjustments far more targeted.
The often-overlooked Domain History data set in Semrush is invaluable for strategic planning. It shows current competitor strategies and historical trends, offering insights for proactive market positioning.
Analyze your backlink profile and remove toxic backlinks
Find leads by location and web tech stack, and do data-driven targeted email outreach with Lead Finder.

Try it now
We use Google Data Studio to visualize this data and provide a holistic view of our SEO performance. Together, Semrush and Google Data Studio form an indispensable toolset that informs and guides our SEO strategy, making them my go-to resources for SEO management.
What's one piece of advice for SEO marketers on closing 2023 successfully?
Don't overlook the importance of diving into your own data. A comprehensive review of your KPIs, analytics, and conversion metrics is the first step in understanding what worked and what needs adjustment.
Experimentation is key; whether you're tweaking the placement of your call-to-action buttons, refining meta descriptions, or experimenting with various content formats, you need to figure out what strategies will be most effective for your audience and market.
Align your content strategy with your analytical findings and prepare for upcoming trends. Content is still king in the SEO world, and relevance is its queen.
But don't stop there; examine your competitors' performance, too. Knowing where they stand in the market provides insights and reveals exploitable opportunities.
What advice would you give someone just starting out with SEO?
Start by understanding the basics of how search engines work-from crawling and indexing to the algorithms that determine rankings. Begin with technical SEO to ensure your website is easily crawlable and has clean URLs and well-configured meta tags.
Then, focus on creating high-quality, relevant content that truly serves your users' needs. Make sure your website is fast, mobile-friendly, and easy to navigate.
Finally, use analytics tools like Google Analytics to monitor user behavior and refine your strategy accordingly.
"Remember, your main objective shouldn't be constantly worrying about what Google wants; think about what your users want."
Stay tuned for our next edition of SEO Spotlight!
